channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: "Canadians are frustrated with our neighbors," ambassador Kirsten Hillman says
item.description: Kirsten Hillman, the Canadian ambassador to the U.S., tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that amid the ongoing war of words over tariffs wi...

item.title: Gene Hackman died at home a week after wife Betsy Arakawa died from hantavirus, authorities say
Kristi Noem says she will use "every single one" of "extensive" authorities as DHS secretary
item.description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that the authorities that she has are "broad and extensive" as s...

item.title: Pope Francis thanks medical staff for 'tender' care
item.description: The Vatican said on Saturday the Pope had shown a "good response" in recent days to his treatment at Rome's Gemelli hospital.

item.title: China preparing for a protracted trade war with U.S.
item.description: China announced retaliatory tariffs on U.S. agricultural products and targeted 25 American companies in response to the now 20% blanket tariffs Presid...

item.title: This Women's History Month, readers tell NPR about the women who changed their lives
item.description: Since 1995, presidents have issued a series of proclamations celebrating Women's History in March. NPR readers share stories of the women who have mad...

item.title: Trump dismisses concerns over back-and-forth levies, says 'tariffs could go up'
item.description: President Trump says economy is in a "period of transition" and can't predict if U.S. will fall into a recession

item.title: Takeaways from the Gene Hackman and Betsy Arakawa deaths investigation
item.description: Authorities say Gene Hackman spent his final years retired from acting, living with heart disease and Alzheimer’s.

item.title: Secret Service says it shot an armed man near the White House after a confrontation
item.description: A man who was brandishing a firearm in Washington, D.C., was shot by Secret Service officers near the White House on Sunday morning, the Secret Servic...

item.title: Secret Service shoots armed man outside White House
item.description: President Donald Trump was not in the White House at the time.

item.title: A timeline of how actor Gene Hackman and Betsy Arakawa died at their New Mexico home
Pope Francis pens prayer thanking hospital staff, as he shows 'mild improvement'
item.description: The Holy See Press Office said the pontiff has shown "a good response to the therapies." He was hospitalized on Feb. 14 for a case of bronchitis.

item.title: Syria leader calls for peace after hundreds of civilians killed
item.description: More than 700 civilians of the Alawite religious minority have been killed, the British-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights says.

item.title: Syrians describe terror as Alawite families killed in their homes
item.description: Witnesses said the situation stabilised when security forces arrived following the violence.

item.title: Kristi Noem says she plans to use "broad and extensive" authorities as DHS secretary
item.description: Department of Homeland Security Secretary Krisi Noem said tests polygraph tests will continue for employees, while pledging to prosecute leakers.

item.title: President's church donation sparks Kenyan clashes
item.description: Police fire tear gas to stop protesters occupying a church which had accepted William Ruto's donation.

item.title: This synagogue calls itself 'anti-Zionist.' Here's what that means in practice
item.description: Tzedek Chicago calls itself anti-Zionist congregation, meaning it does not support a Jewish nation-state.

item.title: Canadians deal with tariff threats amid Trudeau successor battle
item.description: As President Trump threatens tariffs on the Canadian dairy and lumber industry — while holding off on broader tariffs on goods covered under the USMCA...
